original_title: Ingenuity May Be Grounded, But its Legacy Will Be Grand
original_content:
[Eric Berger] has a thoughtful and detailed article explaining why Ingenuity, NASAs small helicopter on Mars, was probably far more revolutionary than many realize, and has a legacy to grant the future of off-world exploration that is already being felt.
Ingenuity was recently grounded due to rotor damage, having already performed far beyond the scope of its original mission. The damage, visible by way of a shadow from one of the rotors, might not look like much at first glance, but flying in the vanishingly-thin atmosphere of Mars requires the 1.18 meter (3.9 foot) carbon fiber blades to spin at very high speeds  meaning even minor rotor damage could be devastating.
Perseverance and Ingenuity pose for a selfie on Mars.
[Eric] points out a lot that is deeply interesting and influential about Ingenuity. Not only is successful powered flight on another planet a real Wright brothers moment, but how Ingenuity came to be validates a profoundly different engineering approach for NASA.
To work in the space industry is to be constrained by mass. But even so, Ingenuitys creators had a mere four pounds to work with. Thats for rotors, hardware, electronics, batteries, solar panel  all of it. NASAs lightest computer module alone weighed a pound, so engineers had no choice but to depart from the usual NASA way of doing things to get it done at all. Not everyone  at NASA was on board. But Ingenuity worked, and it worked wonderfully.
Powered flight opens new doors, and not just for support roles like navigation planning. Theres real science that can be done if powered flight is on the table. For example, [Eric] points out that inaccessible terrain such as the Valles Marineris canyon on Mars is doubtlessly scientifically fascinating, but at 4,000 km long and up to 7 km deep, rover-based exploration is not an option.
title: マーズのイニューティが画期的な成果を収め、宇宙探査の未来に影響を与える
body: Eric Berger氏による記事はIngenuityという火星の小型ヘリコプターが非常に革新的であり、オフワールド探査の未来に影響を与えていることを説明しています。Ingenuityは元のミッションの範囲を大幅に超えて活動していましたが、ローターの損傷により飛行が停止しました。火星の極めて薄い大気中での高速回転が必要であり、ささいな損傷でも致命的になる可能性があります。Ingenuityの成功した有人飛行は、NASAにとって非常に異なるエンジニアリング手法の正当性を証明しています。航空力学の研究や未開地の探索に大いなる可能性をもたらします。
